reviews.text:
Absolutely amazing play café!
This role play cafe is absolutely wonderful. I love that the café seating is inside the play area so it’s easier to keep an eye on the kids. The role play stations themselves were a great hit. Seating was comfy and had little storage cubbies underneath which was a great idea to store things away without getting in kids way. Everything about it was child-friendly and very well thought out, even down to the toilet having a toddler sized seat, stool, and baby changing area with spare nappies etc too! The food was also delicious and halal which is a great bonus! Only improvement I can say is to potentially have a portable ramp/one built in just for easier buggy access into the café. The owners are also very lovely, helpful and welcoming. We’re very pleased with our visit and how local it is, been wanting something like this for a long time! Will be going again for sure!

I came this morning with my two children aged 3 and 18 months. We all had such a lovely time! The play area is clean and not worn out. The coffee was great. It’s the perfect size for the two of them to explore without loosing one! The owner was also very helpful getting up the two stairs in and bringing my coffee over to me. Would really recommend.

We recently celebrated my 2-year-old's birthday at this amazing kids' play area (30/09/23 at 11), and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. The staff did an exceptional job of making the day special, ensuring that everything ran smoothly.

The role-play area was a highlight, providing endless entertainment for the little ones and sparking their imaginations. It was incredible to see how much fun the children had while exploring various scenarios and interacting with the well-designed props.

Overall, it was a blast for everyone, and I can't recommend this place enough for a memorable kids' birthday celebration. Kudos to the staff for their hard work and dedication in creating such a wonderful experience for our little ones!

My little one really enjoyed himself and asked to come back! The photos don’t do justice to this cosy role play cafe. Ah and not to mention the lovely coffee and delicious bakes which you can enjoy while the kids play!!! They also have a variety of snacks for the kids :) The seating area is laid out in a way that you can see your child/children play anywhere you sit. Don’t hesitate to book a session you’ll be booking the next one while you’re there!

Such an adorable role play cafe. Had a party here today for eight 16 month olds and they all had a blast. Nadia was super accommodating and helpful in planning. The coffee is so good (big plus in the mom world) and she has baked goods and snacks for kids. Very reasonably priced and in a great location. Can’t recommend it enough.  We’ll be back!

address: 10 Tanner's Hill, London SE8 4PJ, United Kingdom
